CatDescriptText: Napoleon Green, bakery employee, Pittsburgh 10 and Paul Smith, student, Hill, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1962, pg. 9 with question: "Do you thin kit is right for non-students to be banned from high school football games in the city because of potential violence such as was exhibited at two games two weeks ago?" Mr. Green's answer reads: "I don't think it is right because I think they should have a right to go to the games. It is a free country."  Mr. Smith's answer reads: "Yes, I think they should because when they come back, former students, that is, the younger students like to be around them, and then they want to start trouble."
TitMainTitle: Napoleon Green wearing houndstooth coat, and Paul Smith, standing in front of street with automobiles, church, and buildings
